title: For Sale:  Custom hi cap double stack modular 1911 aka 2011 officer size chambered in .40 S&W similar to STI VIP
postcontent:
I am testing the waters on this one. I love this firearm! If it sells for my asking price, so be it. If it doesn't sell, that's OK too. I am POSSIBLY selling it to fund other interests.
 
You are looking at a completely custom built Modular 1911 AKA HI Cap 2011 pistol chambered in .40 S&W. This firearm was built to 1911 Officer frame and grip length. It holds 13 + 1 rounds. This was built a couple years back as the ultimate CCW pistol for me. All work was performed by a professional Machinist. This was built to be similar to the STI VIP, but with a .5" shorter barrel, and a few more "trick" options like the Cylinder and Slide custom hammer and recessed mag.
 
Frame...
Pheonix Trinity 7075 Aluminum with a Wilson Nowlin ramp cut. The dust cover was finished to Officer length with a slight radius machined in to match, but mirror the bevel of the slide. The recoil rod frame side abutment was cut back .050" rather than the full .100" to keep from weakening the aluminum frame, and to allow lower barrel lug protection. The remaining .050 was removed from the recoil rod abutment plate to make for a bind free recoil spring. The recoil spring is a Wolff 24lb. Officer spring with 1 coil removed to ensure a bind free recoil system. The slide to frame fit was set at .001 clearance. This allows for reliable cycling even when the firearm gets hot. It was set up as a defense firearm, not a super tight mantel piece. 
 
Grip area....
The grip is a polymer STI double stack grip that was shortened .825" in length to make it Officer length. It was shaved of factory castings, and it along with the polymer Officer main spring housing were stippled in a Starburst pattern for aesthetics, and a positive hand grasp. The trigger guard then had finger reliefs added for grip comfort. The trigger, and mag release are also both STI. The trigger is the STI aluminum version. The magazine is a STI magazine that was custom shortened to fit the grip (It can use any .40 S&W STI double stack magazine, but will have a gap at the lower well area. A 120mm length mag will yield a .200 gap). It will hold 13 rounds of .40 S&W with one more in the chamber with this custom mag. The grip safety is a GI that was blended to the frame and grip after having the upper extension removed. The extension was removed due to not being needed because of the custom hammer, and it is one less thing to stab you when you are concealing. The mainspring is a factory Colt Officer spring. The trigger / sear spring is a Wolff. The sear was custom gound and polished, then the weight was set to a light crisp 3.5lb. pull.
 
Slide....
The slide is a stainless steel 3.5" Officer slide. It was lightened, the sides were then block sanded, and polished to a mirror shine. The slide serrations were milled .015 below side height so grip tape could be installed flush with the sides. The grip tape was used so you can rack the slide in ALL conditions, including wet hands, or a wet firearm. Extra grip tape cut to size will come with the firearm so you have replacements, and templates if you choose to change the color. The top of the slide is brushed stainless as to not cause a glare in your sight picture. The sights are large white dot GI slights. These sights were used because the rear can be used to rack the slide on your boot if God forbid you were to loose use of an appendage. I will also include an adjustable rear target sight for the GI dovetail cut in case that is the sight route you prefer.
 
Barrel....
The barrel is a Stainless Fusion Firearms 3.5" match grade bull barrel chambered in .40S&W. It has a Wilson Nowlin ramp that has been polished to feed like a dream. The hood was fit within .002 of the slide on the sides, and breach face. The muzzle end was finished with a 45 degree crown, and a match grade stainless bushing was used, and custom fit. The barrel lockup is .051 due to hand match fit and finish of the lugs. 
 
 
Hammer.....
The hammer is something special too. It is made by Cylinder and Slide. It is called the S.F.S Safety Fast Shooting. It allows you to carry the firearm cocked, and locked.......BUT WITH THE HAMMER DOWN! I attempted to paste a link to it, but this site will not allow me to. Look it up on the net to see how it works.
 
The round count is under 300 down the barrel. I have fired 20 rounds of all box stock ammo you find at Wally World both FMJ, and Hollow point SD, and 50 rounds of my own personal coated lead reloads. This proved to me it will go bang every time, and will cycle all ammo that I would come across. 
 
Thanks for looking! If you have any questions feel free to ask. As always, all Federal, and State laws will be followed with this transaction. Don't ask me to break the law, you will be reported!
